snippet: Ms. Pierson failed to quell a bipartisan political furor over repeated breaches of security and lost the confidence of the president her agency is charged with protecting.
abstract: Julia Pierson resigns under pressure as director of the Secret Service after failing to quell bipartisan political furor over repeated breaches of White House security and losing confidence of Pres Obama; Joseph Clancy, former Secret Service agent in charge of the Presidential Protective Division, is appointed acting director.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: Peter Baker, Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Emmarie Huetteman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Ms. Pierson failed to quell a bipartisan political furor over repeated breaches of security and lost the confidence of the president her agency is charged with protecting.

headline.main: Julia Pierson, Secret Service Director, Resigns Under Pressure About Breaches
headline.print_headline: Secret Service Director Resigns Under Pressure About Breaches
